author: Alex J. Jankowski
title: Prokhorov shows off his skills
text:
Brooklyn Nets owner Mikhail Prokhorov stopped by his team's training camp to teach them a few tricks. (Getty Images) By Alex J. Jankowski 
The Brooklyn Nets don't figure to field a title contender this season. By virtue of playing in the Eastern Conference, they'll likely still make the postseason and little more. 
But don't tell owner Mikhail Prokhorov, who spent Day 2 of the team's training camp showcasing a regiment of Tescao drills -- which looked like little more than basketball tricks. A sampling of Tescao drills demonstrated by #Nets owner Mikhail Prokhorov with the team. pic.twitter.com/WPZ4soEGuf - Brooklyn Nets (@BrooklynNets) September 30, 2015 
The drills essentially work the core as well as hand-eye coordination simultaneously, and it wasn't long before the players got in on the action. A video posted by Tim Bontemps (@timbontemps) on Sep 30, 2015 at 9:29am PDT 
If you've got the time, check out the Instagram account of New York Post reporter Tim Bontemps , who posted multiple videos of the exercises on his feed. 
If you've got the courage, record your own attempts.
